name: androidenterprise_permissions_get
description: Retrieves details of an Android app permission for display to an enterprise admin.

language.description: The BCP47 tag for the user's preferred language (e.g. "en-US", "de")

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

$block: A Permissions resource represents some extra capability, to be granted to an Android app, which requires explicit consent. An enterprise admin must consent to these permissions on behalf of their users before an entitlement for the app can be created. The permissions collection is read-only. The information provided for each permission (localized name and description) is intended to be used in the MDM user interface when obtaining consent from the enterprise.

$ul: **description**: A longer description of the Permissions resource, giving more details of what it affects.
**permissionId**: An opaque string uniquely identifying the permission.
